etymologies: Old English sculdor, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch schouder and German Schulter

definitions: the upper joint of the human arm and the part of the body between this and the neck

examples.text: I was carrying a bag over my shoulder
she turned to look at him over her shoulder
he tapped me on the shoulder and I looked around

shortDefinitions: upper joint of each of person's arms and part of body between this and neck

definitions: (in quadrupeds) the joint of the upper forelimb and the adjacent part of the back.
shortDefinitions: (in quadrupeds) joint of upper forelimb and adjacent part of back

definitions: the part of a bird or insect at which the wing is attached.
shortDefinitions: part of bird or insect at which wing is attached

definitions: a large cut of meat from the upper foreleg and shoulder blade of an animal
shortDefinitions: joint of meat from upper foreleg and shoulder blade of animal

definitions: a part of a garment covering the shoulder
the upper part of the back and arms

examples.text: a tall youth with broad shoulders

shortDefinitions: upper part of back and arms

definitions: the human shoulders regarded as bearing responsibility or hardship or providing strength

examples.text: all accounts place the blame squarely on his shoulders

shortDefinitions: this part of body regarded as bearing responsibility or hardship

definitions: a part of something resembling a shoulder in shape, position, or function
shortDefinitions: part of something resembling shoulder in shape or function

definitions: a point at which a steep slope descends from a plateau or highland area

examples.text: the shoulder of the hill sloped down

shortDefinitions: point at which steep slope descends from plateau or highland area

definitions: a paved strip alongside a road for stopping on in an emergency.

phrases.text: put one's shoulder to the wheel

definitions: put (something heavy) over one's shoulder or shoulders to carry

examples.text: we shouldered our crippling backpacks and set off slowly up the hill

shortDefinitions: put something heavy over one's shoulder or shoulders to carry

examples.text: she shouldered the blame for the incident

definitions: push (someone or something) out of one's way with one's shoulder

notes.text: with object and adverbial of direction

shortDefinitions: push person or thing out of one's way with one's shoulder

definitions: move by shouldering someone or something out of one's way

examples.text: he shouldered past a woman with a baby
he shouldered his way through the seething mass of children

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of direction

phrases.text: put one's shoulder to the wheel
